instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello it's me again...

Got a board with liquid damage, it turns on with battery plugged and Yellow light. 

Water damage was around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, replaced damaged components and the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. 

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:
DCIN 20v
Pin 17/18 3ohm
Pin 19/20 5ohm
Pin 27/28 21ohm 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> diode mode ok, but 0.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> with charger alone (no battery connected)?

Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> diode mode ok"
Can we get a real data?

Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good; check its traces too.
May need to change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>/35 also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> =
Red probe on ground 0.45v
Black probe on ground 2.3v

Changed the <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> (didn't work), checked the rails and OK...
We got delivered new <CHIP>U7100S</CHIP>, so I changed it and get 12.52v ppbus, but something strange is happening.

Fan spin but yellow light on without battery plugged in, battery with lightning appears on the display and it doesn't turn on, is that normal?

PS: probbed the battery connector and it does 12.52v for a couple of seconds, then it goes down to 4v for a second, then 0v and back to 12v in a loop

PPS: at the pin 4 of the <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> I can see the  fluctuation, pin 16 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, is that another faulty <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Amber light on Magsafe is normal, without battery.

Low battery with lightning sign is caused by incorrect charger, I supposse.
Use original 85W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I am using a original 85w charger, but it was the battery, with another battery it turns on, thanks again for helping us
